Title: Sarciadong Pechay
Ingredients: [{"name": "pechay", "amount": "3", "unit": "bunches", "notes": ""}, {"name": "eggs", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "beaten"}, {"name": "tomatoes", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "5", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat oil in a pan. Saut\u00e9 garlic, onion, and tomatoes.", "Add the pechay. Saut\u00e9 for 20 seconds and then pour water. Let it boil.", "Gently pour the beaten egg around the pan. Stir and continue cooking until the eggs start to solidify.", "Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper. Serve with rice.", "Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Ginisang Repolyo with Egg
Ingredients: [{"name": "cabbage", "amount": "1", "unit": "head", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "eggs", "amount": "5", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "carrots", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "julienne (optional)"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "green onions", "amount": "1", "unit": "bunch", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "5", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "1 1/2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sesame oil", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": "optional"}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "ground black pepper", "amount": "1/4", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sugar", "amount": "1/2", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": "optional"}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "5", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Combine chopped cabbage and salt. Mix it altogether. Let it stay for 10 minutes and then rinse with water. Set the cabbage aside.", "Beat the eggs and add a bit of salt and ground black pepper.", "Heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil in a pan. Once the oil gets hot, pour beaten eggs. Cook it until firm and then cut into small pieces using the tip of your spatula or cooking spoon. Remove the egg from the pan. Set it aside.", "Heat the remaining oil. Saut\u00e9 the onion and garlic.", "Once the onion softens. Add the carrots. Saut\u00e9 for 30 seconds.", "Add the cabbage. Continue saut\u00e9ing for 2 minutes.", "Add the soy sauce , oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Cook for 1 minute. Note: this is also the time to add sugar if you want.", "Put the scrambled eggs into the pan and then add the chopped green onions and sesame oil.", "Season it with ground black pepper."]

Title: Fried Eggplant Fritters Talong Okoy
Ingredients: [{"name": "Chinese eggplants", "amount": "5", "unit": "pieces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "eggs", "amount": "2", "unit": "pieces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "green onions", "amount": "1", "unit": "bunch", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "cornstarch", "amount": "4", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "amount": "8", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "baking powder", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "5", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "ground black pepper", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "2", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "2", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "white vinegar", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "red onion", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "piece", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "green onion", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "Thai chili pepper", "amount": "3", "unit": "pieces", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "3", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "sugar", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "ground black pepper", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Grate the eggplants and arrange in a bowl. Sprinkle 4 teaspoons of salt. Toss until the eggplants are evenly coated. Let it stay for 10 minutes.", "Add 2 cups of water into the bowl. Wash the eggplants to get rid of the salt. Grab the eggplants with your hand and squeeze until the water drains completely. You can also put this in a cheesecloth and wring it until the water drains out.", "Combine flour, cornstarch, and baking powder in a bowl. Mix well and then set aside.", "Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the eggplants, green onions, salt, and ground black pepper. Mix it well.", "Gradually add the flour and cornstarch mixture. Mix until all the ingredients are well blended.", "Heat 2 cups of oil in a small pan. Note: the oil must be deep enough for the mixture to float.", "Scoop around 3 tablespoons of the eggplant mixture into the pan with hot oil. Fry until both sides are brown and crispy. Drain the excess oil and arrange the eggplant fritters on a serving plate.", "Make the dipping sauce by combining vinegar, sugar, salt, ground black pepper, and soy sauce in a bowl. Microwave for 30 seconds and then stir until well blended. Add chili peppers, onion, garlic, and green onion. Serve with the eggplant fritters.", "Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Stir Fry Eggplant
Ingredients: [{"name": "Chinese eggplant", "amount": "4", "unit": "pieces", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "ground pork", "amount": "4", "unit": "ounces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cornstarch", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "white vinegar", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "green onions", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "cup", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "2", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "thumbs ginger", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "4", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "Thai chili pepper", "amount": "5", "unit": "pieces", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "sugar", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "vinegar", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Combine 2 cups water, 1 tablespoon salt, and 2 tablespoons vinegar in a large mixing bowl. Stir and then add the sliced eggplants. Soak it for 20 minutes.", "Make the sauce by combining all the sauce ingredients as listed above the ingredient section in a bowl. Mix well and then set aside.", "Remove the eggplants from the bowl and place it in a colander. Gently squeeze until enough water has been extracted from the eggplants. Sprinkle the cornstarch over it and then toss the eggplants until it gets evenly coated. Set this aside.", "Heat 1 tablespoon of cooking oil in a pan. Add the ground pork. Saut\u00e9 this until the color turns light to medium brown.", "Add the eggplants. Continue saut\u00e9ing for 2 minutes.", "Pour the sauce into the pan. Stir and continue cooking using medium heat until the sauce thickens.", "Garnish with chopped green onions and then transfer to a serving plate.", "Serve! Share and enjoy."]

Title: Tofu and Broccoli Stir fry
Ingredients: [{"name": "extra firm tofu", "amount": "8", "unit": "oz.", "notes": "sliced in 1/2 inch thick pieces"}, {"name": "sliced broccoli florets", "amount": "3", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "carrot", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced diagonally (optional)"}, {"name": "medium onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "minced garlic", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "minced ginger", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "6", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat a pan and then pour-in 4 tablespoons of cooking oil.", "When the oil becomes hot, fry both sides of the sliced tofu until the texture becomes crisp (about 8 to 10 minutes per side)", "Remove the tofu from the pan and let cool. Slice into smaller rectangular pieces. Set aside.", "On a clean frying pan, heat the remaining oil.", "Saut\u00e9 the garlic, ginger, and onion", "Add the fried tofu slices along with the oyster sauce. Stir.", "Put-in the broccoli florets. Stir and then cook for 5 to 8 minutes.", "Add salt and pepper to taste.", "Transfer to serving plate.", "Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Ginisang Puso ng Saging
Ingredients: [{"name": "banana heart", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "pork", "amount": "8", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "thinly sliced"}, {"name": "Knorr Pork Cube", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "vermicelli", "amount": "2", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "sotanghon"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "3", "unit": "cloves", "notes": ""}, {"name": "white vinegar", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "5", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Clean the banana heart and slice it into thin pieces. Combine \u00bd cup vinegar and 1 cup of water in a large bowl. Put the sliced banana heart into the mixture. Rub the salt onto it and soak for 10 to 20 minutes. Drain the liquid mixture and then wring the banana hearts (a chunk at a time) to force the liquid to come out. Set aside.", "Soak the vermicelli in 2 cups of water for 12 minutes. Drain the water and then set the vermicelli aside.", "Heat the oil in pan. Saut\u00e9 the garlic and onion until the latter softens.", "Add the pork sliced. Continue to cook until it browns.", "Pour 1 cup of water into the pan. Cover it and let the water boil. Adjust the heat between low to medium heat setting. Cook until the liquid completely evaporates.", "Add the sliced banana hearts. Saut\u00e9 it for 2 minutes.", "Pour the remaining 1 cup of water into the pan. Let it boil. Add Knorr Pork Cube. Cover and cook until the water reduces to half. Note: you can add more water if the banana heart slices needs to be cooked further to soften.", "Remove the cover and season with fish sauce and ground black pepper as needed.", "Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Kangkong and Ground Pork with Oyster Sauce Stir Fry
Ingredients: [{"name": "water spinach", "amount": "\u00be", "unit": "lbs.", "notes": "see note 1"}, {"name": "ground pork", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "lb.", "notes": "see note 2"}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "1", "unit": "head", "notes": "crushed"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "8", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and Ground Black Pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Brown the garlic by slowly frying it in oil until it turns golden brown. Do this by heating the oil in a pan. After around 20 seconds, add the crushed garlic. Stir and fry using a low to medium heat setting until it browns. Separate the garlic with the oil. Set aside. Note: This is an optional step. The browned garlic can be used as a topping or condiment for this dish and for other dishes too.", "Using 3 tablespoons of the oil used to fry the garlic, Saute the onion until it softens.", "Add the ground pork. Saut\u00e9 for 3 to 5 minutes or until the pork turns light brown.", "Add oyster sauce and water. Stir and cook until the water evaporates completely.", "Put the water spinach stalks into the pan. Stir fry for 2 minutes.", "Add the water spinach leaves and a portion of the browned garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Note: you may add up to \u00bd cup of water if you like this with a bit of sauce.", "Season with salt and ground black pepper. Arrange on a serving plate and top with more browned garlic.", "Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Garlic Tokwa and Kangkong in Oyster Sauce
Ingredients: [{"name": "water spinach", "amount": "1", "unit": "bunch", "notes": "kangkong"}, {"name": "tofu", "amount": "12", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "extra firm"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "1", "unit": "head", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Knorr Liquid Seasoning", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cornstarch", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Crush and chop the garlic. Put it on a small pan and then add \u00bd cup cooking oil. Turn on the heat and adjust it to medium setting. Once the oil starts to bubble, adjust the heat to the lowest setting. Continue cooking the garlic while stirring until it turns golden brown in color.", "Separate the garlic from the garlic oil using a kitchen sieve. Set aside.", "Heat the remaining 1 cup of oil on a deep small cooking pot. Add the garlic oil (leaving around 3 tablespoons for later). Fry the tofu until it turns golden brown. Remove the tofu from the pot and let it cool down before dicing it. Set aside.", "Combine all the sauce ingredients in a bowl. Stir until well blended. Set aside.", "Heat the remaining 3 tablespoons of garlic oil in a clean pan. Saut\u00e9 the onions until it softens.", "Add the fried tofu and continue to saute for 30 seconds.", "Add the chopped water spinach (kangkong). Saute for 1 minute.", "Pour the sauce mixture into the pot. Stir and cook until the sauce thickens.", "Add half of the browned garlic and season with salt and ground black pepper as needed.", "Transfer to a serving plate. Top with the remaining garlic. Serve with white rice.", "Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Eggplant with Ground Pork in Oyster Sauce
Ingredients: [{"name": "Chinese eggplants", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "ground pork", "amount": "4", "unit": "ounces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "red bell pepper", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "3", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "ginger", "amount": "1", "unit": "thumb", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Sesame oil", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "brown sugar", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "red bell pepper", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "5", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "green onion", "amount": "3", "unit": "stalks", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat 3 tablespoons of cooking oil in a pan. Fry both sides of the sliced eggplants until it softens. Transfer the eggplants on a clean plate. Set aside.", "Add the remaining cooking oil and sesame oil. Saute the onion, garlic, and ginger.", "Add the ground pork once the onion softens. Saute it until the color turns light brown.", "Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and water. Continue cooking until the liquid evaporates.", "Add the bell pepper and then put the eggplants back into the pan. Stir fry for 3 minutes.", "Season with salt and ground black pepper.", "Serve hot over rice. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Monggo Pinakbet
Ingredients: [{"name": "mung beans", "amount": "12", "unit": "ounces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Knorr Pork Cube", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "shrimp paste", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "string beans", "amount": "12", "unit": "", "notes": "cut into 2-inch pieces"}, {"name": "Chinese eggplant", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced lengthwise"}, {"name": "bitter melon", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "cored and sliced"}, {"name": "Calabaza squash", "amount": "10", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "cubed"}, {"name": "okra", "amount": "8", "unit": "pieces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "tomatoes", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "cubed"}, {"name": "ginger", "amount": "2", "unit": "thumbs", "notes": "crushed"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "5", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "3", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Soak the mung beans in water overnight. Drain the water and set the mung beans aside.", "Heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil in a pan. Saute half of the total amount of garlic, onion, and tomatoes. Once the onion and tomato soften, add the mung beans. Saute for 2 minutes.", "Pour the water into the pot. Let boil.", "Add the Knorr Pork Cube. Stir. Cover the pot and boil the mung beans using low to medium heat for 45 minutes. Note: Add water as needed. Set this aside.", "On a separate pan, saut\u00e9 the remaining garlic, onion, and tomato. Add the ginger. Continue saut\u00e9ing until the onion and tomato softens.", "Add the sliced pork. Saute until the color of the pork turns light brown.", "Pour \u00be cup water. Let it boil. Cover the pot and continue boiling the pork until the water evaporates completely.", "Add the shrimp paste. Saute for 1 minute.", "Add calabaza squash. Cook for 2 minutes.", "Add eggplant, bitter melon, okra, and string beans. Saute for 2 minutes.", "Add \u00bd cup water. Let it boil.", "Pour the cooked mung beans into the pot. Stir and continue cooking for 3 to minutes.", "Season with salt and ground black pepper.", "Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with rice.", "Share and enjoy!"]

"amount": "1/2", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion powder", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "star anise", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "ground black pepper", "amount": "1/4", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Thai chili pepper", "amount": "3", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "white vinegar", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "garlic", "amount": "5", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "crushed"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "Thai chili pepper", "amount": "3", "unit": "", "notes": Instructions: ["Make the manong sauce by boiling water in a cooking pot. Add star anise, brown sugar, Knorr Liquid Seasoning, garlic powder, chili pepper, and onion powder. Stir until well blended. Simmer for 5 minutes.", "Combine cornstarch and 1/4 cup water. Stir and pour into the pot. Continue cooking while constantly stirring the mixture until your desired consistency is achieved. Transfer to a sauce bottle and let it cool down. Set aside.", "Make the spicy vinegar dipping sauce by combining all the ingredients as listed above in a jar or bowl. Mix well. Set aside.", "Make the veggie balls by combining flour and cornstarch in a bowl. Mix well and then gradually add water while mixing.", "Add carrot, green onion, kalabasa, and green peas. Mix well.", "Season with Knorr Liquid Seasoning. Mix until all ingredients are well blended.", "Heat cooking oil in a deep cooking pot. Mold the mixture into balls and then fry in medium heat until it floats, and the exterior part turns golden brown in color.", "Remove from the pot and skewer using bamboo sticks. Dip in manong sauce or spicy vinegar before eating.", "Make the eggplant balls by boiling the peeled eggplant until it gets tender. Cut it into smaller pieces and then mash. Combine with egg, all-purpose flour, onion, garlic, salt, and ground black pepper. Mix well. Form into balls and roll it over the panko breadcrumbs. Deep fry in low to medium heat until the color turns golden brown. Remove from the pot and let it cool down. Dip in manong sauce or spicy vinegar before eating.", "Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Crab and Corn Chopsuey
Ingredients: [{"name": "extra firm tofu", "amount": "8", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "fried"}, {"name": "Knorr Crab and Corn Soup", "amount": "37", "unit": "grams", "notes": ""}, {"name": "quail eggs", "amount": "12", "unit": "", "notes": "boiled"}, {"name": "cauliflower florets", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "broccoli florets", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "carrot", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "snow peas", "amount": "15", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "red bell pepper", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "green bell pepper", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cabbage", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "yellow onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "4", "unit": "cloves", "notes": ""}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat oil in a wok. Saut\u00e9 onion and garlic until the onion softens.", "Add carrot , cauliflower, and broccoli. Cook for 2 minutes.", "Add cabbage, bell pepper, and snow peas. Toss.", "Add soy sauce and oyster sauce and continue cooking for 2 minutes.", "Combine water and Knorr Crab and Corn Soup Mix. Stir and pour into the wok. Let it boil.", "Add fried tofu and quail eggs. Continue cooking until the sauce reduces and thickens.", "Season with salt and ground black pepper as needed.", "Transfer to a serving plate.", "Serve. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Amazing Cabbage

Instructions: ["Make the ginisang upo with sardinas by sauteeing garlic and onion in a pan. Add the bottle gourd once the onion softens. Continue cooking for 3 minutes. Add Knorr Liquid Seasoning. Pour the sardines with tomato sauce into the pan and add \u00bd cup water. Cover and cook for 1 to 3 to 5 minutes. Squeeze lemon and then season with salt and ground black pepper. Serve.", "Make the misua soup by sauteeing onion and garlic in a cooking pot. Add the ground pork. Continue cooking while separating it into pieces until it browns. Add Knorr Pork Cube and water. Let boil. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Put the bottle gourd and misua. Cover and cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Add green onions and season with fish sauce and ground black pepper. Add toasted garlic. Serve hot.", "Make the ginataang upo by sauteeing onion and garlic in a pan. Add the bottle gourd. Saute for 2 minutes and then add the dried anchovies. Pour the vinegar. Combine 1 \u00bd cups water and Knorr Ginataang Gulay Mix. Stir and pour into the pan. Let it boil and continue cooking for 3 minutes. Add chili pepper. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper. Trransfer to a serving bowl. Serve with rice.", "Make the chicken tinola soup by sauteeing onion, garlic, and ginger in a cooking pot. Add the chicken once the onion softens. Saute until the chicken turns light brown and then pour 5 cups water. Let it boil. Add Knorr Chicken Cube. Reduce heat to low setting. Cover the pot and continue cooking for 15 minutes. Add bottle gourd and boil for 3 minutes. Put the spinach into the pot. Season with fish sauce and ground black pepper. Serve hot."]

Title: Nutritious Ulam Idea
Ingredients: [{"name": "Knorr Cream of Mushroom Soup", "amount": "38", "unit": "grams", "notes": ""}, {"name": "quail eggs", "amount": "12", "unit": "", "notes": "boiled"}, {"name": "butter", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "whole kernel corn", "amount": "15", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "canned"}, {"name": "string beans", "amount": "2", "unit": "cups", "notes": "cut into small pieces"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "4", "unit": "cloves", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "carrot", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "diced"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and ground black pepper", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": "to taste"}]
Instructions: ["Melt butter in a pan. Saute garlic and onion.", "Add carrot once the onion softens. Cook for 2 minutes.", "Add whole kernel corn and string beans. Cook for 2 mimutes.", "Combine Knorr Cream of Mushroom Soup and water. Stir.  Pour the mixture into the pan. Stir and cook until the mixture thickens.", "Season with salt and ground black pepper.", "Add the boiled quail eggs. Gently stir.", "Serve this with your fried main dish."]

Title: Tofu Vegetable Stir Fry
Ingredients: [{"name": "cabbage", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "head", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "Knorr Chicken Cube", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "baby bok choy", "amount": "1", "unit": "bunch", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "shiitake mushrooms", "amount": "6", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "snow peas", "amount": "15", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "tofu", "amount": "12", "unit": "oz.", "notes": "extra firm, cubed"}, {"name": "green peas", "amount": "\u00be", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "carrot", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "4", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "crushed"}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sesame oil", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cornstarch", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sugar", "amount": "1/2", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat 1 cup of oil in a small cooking pot. Deep fry the tofu until it turns golden brown. Set aside.", "Heat 3 tablespoons of the same oil in a wok. Saut\u00e9 onion and garlic.", "Add mushrooms and carrot once the onion softens.", "Pour the soy sauce. Saut\u00e9 for 2 minutes.", "Add snow peas, Knorr Chicken Cube, and water. Let boil.", "Put the oyster sauce along with the cabbage, bok choy, and green peas into the wok. Toss. Cover. Cook for 3 minutes.", "Add the fried tofu and season with sugar, salt, and ground black pepper.", "Combine cornstarch with 3 tablespoons water. Mix well and then pour into the wok. Stir and continue cooking until the sauce thickens.", "Finish by adding sesame oil.", "Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with rice.", "Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Relyenong Talong with Tuna
Ingredients: [{"name": "eggplants", "amount": "3", "unit": "", "notes": "large"}, {"name": "Knorr Liquid Seasoning", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "eggs", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "tuna", "amount": "12", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "in can"}, {"name": "bell pepper", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "carrot", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "2", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "green onion", "amount": "1/2", "unit": "cup", "notes": "chopepd"}]
Instructions: ["Slice the eggplants crosswise, half an inch thick. Create eggplant rings by cutting around the inside part of each sliced eggplant. Chop the part that has been cut-out and set it aside.", "Heat 3 tablespoons of cooking oil in a pan. Saut\u00e9 onion and garlic. Add tuna and chopped eggplant once the onion softens. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Season with Knorr Liquid Seasoning. Transfer to a mixing bowl and let it cool down.", "Beat the eggs and add it to the cooked mixture in the bowl. Also add half of the carrot, green onions, and bell peppers. Mix well.", "Heat the remaining oil. Fry one side of the eggplant rings for 1 minute.", "Turn the eggplant over to cook the opposite side. Sprinkle some minced carrot, bell pepper, and green onions in each ring. Top it with a scoop of tuna mixture. Gently spread the mixture within the ring. Set your stove to medium heat and continue cooking for 2 minutes.", "Top the mixture with minced carrot, bell pepper, and green onions. Turn it over and cook the other side for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the relyenong talong from the pan and arrange it on a serving plate. Serve with banana ketchup. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Cabbage Rolls
Ingredients: [{"name": "Napa cabbage Leaves", "amount": "12", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "4", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "ice cold water", "amount": "3", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "panko breadcrumbs", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "eggs", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "beaten"}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Knorr Pork Cube", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "egg", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "amount": "5", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "carrot", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "green onion", "amount": "\u00bd", "unit": "cup", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "ground pork", "amount": "1", "unit": "lb.", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "5", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sesame oil", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Salt and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Boil 4 cups of water in a cooking pot. Add 1 teaspoon salt.", "Put the Napa cabbage in the pot. Boil for 1 minute. Pour cold water in a large bowl. Remove the cabbage from the pot and submerge it into the cold water until it cools-down. Remove and dry the cabbage. Set aside.", "Cook the meat filling by heating 3 tablespoons of cooking oil in a pan. Saut\u00e9 the garlic until it starts to brown. Add onion. Cook until the onion softens. Add the ground pork and continue cooking while stirring until the pork turns light brown. Add Knorr Pork Cube and then cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and ground black pepper. Transfer to a large bowl. Let it cool down.", "Add minced carrot, minced green onion, egg, all-purpose flour, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Mix well.", "Scoop 3 tablespoons of the meat mixture and arrange it over a piece of Napa cabbage. Secure the filling by folding both sided of the cabbage inwards and roll until the filling is completely covered. Secure by inserting a toothpick into the cabbage roll.", "Start to fry the cabbage rolls by heating cooking oil in a pan. Meanwhile, dredge the cabbage roll in all-purpose flour, dip in beaten egg, and dredge in panko breadcrumbs until completely coated. Fry one side until it turns golden brown. Turn it over and do the same on the opposite side. Remove from the pan place over a plate lined with paper towel or on a wire rack. Let it cool down.", "Slice the cabbage rolls into bite-sized pieces. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Ginataang Sitaw at Kalabasa with Fried Tilapia
Ingredients: [{"name": "tilapia", "amount": "3", "unit": "lbs.", "notes": "cleaned and scales removed"}, {"name": "Knorr Ginataang Gulay Mix", "amount": "45", "unit": "grams", "notes": ""}, {"name": "calabaza squash", "amount": "1", "unit": "lb.", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "string beans", "amount": "12", "unit": "", "notes": "cut in 2-inch length pieces"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "4", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "crushed and chopped"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Prepare the fish by washing it thoroughly. Let it dry. Rub salt all over it and into the cavity.", "Heat 1 cup cooking oil in a pan. Fry one side of the fish until it gets golden brown and crispy. Turn it over and do the same procedure on the opposite side. Remove from the pan arrange on a serving plate. Set aside.", "Cook the ginataang sitaw by sauteeing garlic and onion in a pan.", "Add the sliced calabaza squash (kalabasa). Stir-fry for 2 minutes.", "Add the string beans. Cook while occasionally stirring for 2 minutes.", "Combine Knorr Ginataang Gulay Mix and 1 \u00bd cups water. Stir and pour it into the pan. Cover the pan with a lid and let the liquid boil. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes.", "You can season with salt and ground black pepper as needed.", "Serve with rice and fried tilapia. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Pork Monggo with Fried Galunggong
Ingredients: [{"name": "mung beans", "amount": "1 \u00bd", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Knorr Pork Cube", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "pork", "amount": "4", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "cut into small pieces"}, {"name": "hot pepper leaves", "amount": "1", "unit": "bunch", "notes": ""}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "4", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "tomatoes", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "diced"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "5", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "round scad", "amount": "2", "unit": "lbs.", "notes": "galunggong, cleaned"}, {"name": "salt", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Start to tenderize the mung beans by boiling 4 cups of water in a cooking pot. Add the mung beans. Cover and cook in low heat setting until it softens.", "Meanwhile, prepare the fish by rubbing salt all over it, including the cavity. Heat 1 cups of cooking oil in a pan. Fry the fish until it gets crispy. Set aside.", "Cook the pork monggo by heating 3 tablespoons of cooking oil that you used to fry the fish. Saute garlic, onion, and tomato.", "Once the onion softens, add the pork. Cook it until it starts to brown. Pour 1 cup water. Let it boil. Cover and continue cooking for 10 minutes.", "Add the softened mung beans and more water as needed. Stir and cook for 5 minutes.", "Add hot pepper leaves and season with fish sauce and ground black pepper.", "Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with warm rice and fried galunggong. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Utan nga Langka
Ingredients: [{"name": "unripe jackfruit", "amount": "2", "unit": "lbs.", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "Knorr Shrimp cube", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "coconut milk", "amount": "3", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "bago leaves", "amount": "2", "unit": "cups", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "dried fish", "amount": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": "dulong"}, {"name": "onions", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "5", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "Thai chili pepper", "amount": "3", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "vinegar", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "Fish sauce to taste", "amount": "", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat oil in a large wok.", "Saut\u00e9 onion and garlic.", "Add the dried fish once the onions soften. Cook for 1 minute.", "Add unripe jackfruit. Cook while stirring for 2 to 3 minutes.", "Add chili peppers and bago leaves. Stir.", "Season with 1 tablespoon fish sauce and then pour-in the coconut milk. Let boil.", "Add vinegar. Cook for 5 to 8 minutes.", "Add Knorr Shrimp Cube. Continue cooking until the liquid evaporates completely.", "Season with ground black pepper and fish sauce as needed.", "Transfer to a serving plate. Serve with warm rice.", "Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Spicy Eggplant Stir Fry
Ingredients: [{"name": "eggplants", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced into serving pieces"}, {"name": "string beans", "amount": "8", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "1", "unit": "head", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "minced"}, {"name": "Thai chili peppers", "amount": "12", "unit": "", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "brown sugar", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "soy sauce", "amount": "3", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "white vinegar", "amount": "1", "unit": "tablespoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oyster sauce", "amount": "2", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sesame oil", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "amount": "1/4", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cornstarch", "amount": "2", "unit": "teaspoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Brush the eggplants with oil. Pan fry until it softens. Remove from the pan and set aside.", "Combine all the sauce ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Set aside.", "Heat the remaining oil in a pan. Saut\u00e9 the garlic, onion, and chili pepper.", "Add the string beans once the onion softens. Stir fry for 1 minute.", "Pour the sauce into the pan. Cook while stirring until it thickens.", "Add the fried eggplant. Continue stir-frying until the string beans get cooked completely.", "Transfer to a serving plate. Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!"]

Title: Healthy Ginataang Gulay with Tofu and Shrimp
Ingredients: [{"name": "shrimp", "amount": "6 to 8", "unit": "pieces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "tofu", "amount": "6", "unit": "ounces", "notes": "diced and fried"}, {"name": "Knorr Ginataang Gulay Mix", "amount": "40", "unit": "grams", "notes": ""}, {"name": "carrots", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "long green beans", "amount": "12", "unit": "ounces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "broccoli", "amount": "4", "unit": "ounces", "notes": ""}, {"name": "red bell pepper", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced"}, {"name": "turmeric powder", "amount": "1", "unit": "teaspoon", "notes": ""}, {"name": "onion", "amount": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "thumbs ginger", "amount": "2", "unit": "", "notes": "sliced into strips"}, {"name": "garlic", "amount": "3", "unit": "cloves", "notes": "chopped"}, {"name": "water", "amount": "\u00bc", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "cooking oil", "amount": "4", "unit": "tablespoons", "notes": ""}]
Instructions: ["Heat oil in a wok or wide pan. Fry shrimp for 1 minute per side. Remove from the pan and set aside.", "Using the remaining oil, saut\u00e9 onion, garlic, and ginger.", "Add carrot, long green beans. Cook for 1 minute.", "Add broccoli, bell pepper, and half of the fried tofu. Cook for 2 minutes.", "Combine Knorr Ginataang Gulay Mix with 1 \u00bd cups water. Mix well and then pour into the pan.", "Add turmeric powder and fried shrimp. Cover the pan and continue cooking for 5 to 7 minutes or until the vegetables are cooked according to your preference.", "Season with ground black pepper and salt.", "Add the remaining tofu. Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!"]
